item.title: Lorda: a generative art homage to wine
item.description: A Journey Through Entre Rios became a genart project called ‘Lorda’ Argentina is world-renowned for its exquisite wine, and the Malbec grape has long been a celebrated variety. While most of the country’s wine comes from the region of Cuyo, specifically the province of Mendoza, there is another hidden gem that is often overlooked: Entre Rios. Photo from Mendoza Named after the two massive rivers that surround it, Entre Rios is a province located in the northeast of Argentina.
